repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

comment_data.body: Are you sure this is needed? There's already a builtin check which shows at startup: https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/5ea5812714bcbeb6a5438c80d410984ad4fbb922/src/nvim/main.c#L2006
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -54,9 +54,16 @@ local function check_config()
   health.start('Configuration')
   local ok = true
 
-  local vimrc = (
-    empty(vim.env.MYVIMRC) and vim.fn.stdpath('config') .. '/init.vim' or vim.env.MYVIMRC
-  )
+  local init_lua_path = vim.fn.stdpath('config') .. '/init.lua'
+  local init_vim_path = vim.fn.stdpath('config') .. '/init.vim'
+  if filereadable(init_lua_path) and filereadable(init_vim_path) then
+    health.warn('You can have either Vimscript ("init.vim") or Lua ("init.lua"), but not both.')

comment_data.body:
should probably default to init.lua rather than init.vim, for messaging.
```suggestion
  local vimrc = (empty(vim.env.MYVIMRC) and init_lua_path or vim.env.MYVIMRC)
```
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -54,9 +54,16 @@ local function check_config()
   health.start('Configuration')
   local ok = true
 
-  local vimrc = (
-    empty(vim.env.MYVIMRC) and vim.fn.stdpath('config') .. '/init.vim' or vim.env.MYVIMRC
-  )
+  local init_lua_path = vim.fn.stdpath('config') .. '/init.lua'
+  local init_vim_path = vim.fn.stdpath('config') .. '/init.vim'
+  if filereadable(init_lua_path) and filereadable(init_vim_path) then
+    health.warn('You can have either Vimscript ("init.vim") or Lua ("init.lua"), but not both.')
+  end
+
+  local init_path = filereadable(init_lua_path) and init_lua_path or init_vim_path
+
+  local vimrc = (empty(vim.env.MYVIMRC) and init_path or vim.env.MYVIMRC)

comment_data.body: It is not needed, have removed
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -54,9 +54,16 @@ local function check_config()
   health.start('Configuration')
   local ok = true
 
-  local vimrc = (
-    empty(vim.env.MYVIMRC) and vim.fn.stdpath('config') .. '/init.vim' or vim.env.MYVIMRC
-  )
+  local init_lua_path = vim.fn.stdpath('config') .. '/init.lua'
+  local init_vim_path = vim.fn.stdpath('config') .. '/init.vim'
+  if filereadable(init_lua_path) and filereadable(init_vim_path) then
+    health.warn('You can have either Vimscript ("init.vim") or Lua ("init.lua"), but not both.')

comment_data.body: Now that this is in a single line I would remove the outer parentheses.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -54,15 +54,16 @@ local function check_config()
   health.start('Configuration')
   local ok = true
 
-  local vimrc = (
-    empty(vim.env.MYVIMRC) and vim.fn.stdpath('config') .. '/init.vim' or vim.env.MYVIMRC
-  )
+  local init_lua_path = vim.fn.stdpath('config') .. '/init.lua'
+
+  local vimrc = (empty(vim.env.MYVIMRC) and init_lua_path or vim.env.MYVIMRC)

@@ -54,15 +54,16 @@ local function check_config()
   health.start('Configuration')
   local ok = true
 
-  local vimrc = (
-    empty(vim.env.MYVIMRC) and vim.fn.stdpath('config') .. '/init.vim' or vim.env.MYVIMRC
-  )
+  local init_lua_path = vim.fn.stdpath('config') .. '/init.lua'
+
+  local vimrc = empty(vim.env.MYVIMRC) and init_lua_path or vim.env.MYVIMRC
+
   if not filereadable(vimrc) then
     ok = false
     local has_vim = filereadable(vim.fn.expand('~/.vimrc'))
     health.warn(
       (-1 == vim.fn.getfsize(vimrc) and 'Missing' or 'Unreadable') .. ' user config file: ' .. vimrc,
-      { has_vim and ':help nvim-from-vim' or ':help init.vim' }
+      { has_vim and ':help nvim-from-vim' or ':help init.lua' }

comment_regular_data.body: Previous commit flipped the problem of #25291 . I pushed a fix

Lots of tui_spec failures, can't see how that is related.

```
ERROR    test/functional/terminal/tui_spec.lua @ 75: TUI rapid resize #7572 #7628
test/functional/ui/screen.lua:178: EOF was received from Nvim. Likely the Nvim process crashed.
```

I see that failure in other PRs, so not related.

> Lots of tui_spec failures, can't see how that is related.
> 
> ```
> ERROR    test/functional/terminal/tui_spec.lua @ 75: TUI rapid resize #7572 #7628
> test/functional/ui/screen.lua:178: EOF was received from Nvim. Likely the Nvim process crashed.
> ```
> 
> I see that failure in other PRs, so not related.

Thank you for helping. 
Not sure if I'll be useful, but I'll have a look at those unrelated tests.

Thank you for fixing this !
The wrong behavior is still present in 0.9.5.
Are there any plan to backport this change to the stable release ?

title: fix: checkhealth warning even if init.lua exists
